intro: Morinda nanlingensis var. pauciflora, commonly known as the Nanling mountain morinda, is a rare flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. It has a short stem and produces red or orange fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
